content: The Krebs cycle, commonly understood as a simple set of reactions for cellular energy generation, can also run in reverse to convert simple gases into living matter.
The reverse operation of the Krebs cycle, turning simple gases into living matter, could be the mechanism by which life on Earth began.
The tension between creation (forming organic molecules from gases) and destruction (burning organic molecules in respiration) within the Krebs cycle underpins ageing and diseases like cancer.
The tension between creation and destruction in the Krebs cycle might give rise to consciousness itself.
